intro: Psephellus carbonatus, commonly known as the black sandplant, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent foliage and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. Psephellus carbonatus is often found growing on sandy or rocky soils near the shoreline.
